poem:
Kevin Bacon at 65

Among the skyscrapers
and the endless fields,
the years whittle down
to this:

a shared apartment,
sun on a farm.

Contentment is the cat
curled on a windowsill,
the morning stretching
between ambition
and rest.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘You have to get over the me thing’: Kevin Bacon on money, marriage – and learning to live with himself There’s a state that veteran Hollywood actors can reach, beyond ravenous ambition, but with retirement still distant, that seems to make them contented as professionals and mellow as people. Kevin Bacon, now 65, has hit that sweet spot. Continually employed for decades, he shares a Manhattan apartment as well as a Connecticut farm with his". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
